parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the frame welds can cause the frame to crack, leading to a loss of structural integrity, which can result in accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: particularly in the rear triangular area
and on both sides of the passenger floorboards; the frame may be deemed non-repairable by dealerships.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Difficulty with Recall Repairs and Service
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of dealerships to properly perform recall repairs and provide adequate service can lead to delays, inconvenience, and a lack of trust in the manufacturer and its representatives.
symptoms: Dealerships refusing to perform recall repairs

citing lack of certified welders or availability; dealerships providing inadequate or temporary fixes; manufacturers providing inadequate support and written assurances; and difficulties in getting recall work performed.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the cooling system can cause the engine to overheat, leading to damage to the engine and potentially causing a loss of coolant, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The temperature gauge enters the red danger zone
the cooling fan operation affects the temperature gauge
the brake light operation affects the temperature gauge.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Rear Foot Pedal Brake Shudder and Diminished Braking Power
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The shudder and diminished braking power can cause the rider to lose control of the motorcycle, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The motorcycle shudders violently when the rear foot pedal brake is applied without the front hand brake
especially in high ambient temperatures (above 105Â°F); braking power is reduced; applying the front brake usually eliminates the shudder.
